::Savanna::

She keeps her distance from the other bots.  She is wary of the 
strange bots that had arrived.  She spoke into her comlink.
"Phobia, I am Savanna. What is your situation and what do you need 
assistance with?"  She looked at the other bots.  She took a few 
steps closer to them so that they might see her, but left enough room 
for her to mauver incase of attack.  She let out a soft growl from 
her throat.  Her lion side made her want to pounce first and ask 
questions later.  But she kept her distance.




--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> (A regular wizard of oz scenario cowardly lion included.) 
> 
> Phobia check long distance scanners to make sure that only 4 bots 
> were in the area before lowering his shields and shutting down his 
> guns. (The guns wouldn't do any good if you approached from the 
> side.)"I have shown you a gesture of trust, now do the same for me. 
> transform to bot mode (IF not already in bot mode) and lower your 
> weapons to your sides. If you have optic blasters please approach 
> with them off line." 
> 
> (I know I'm taking liberties here just prease bear with me.) The 
four 
> Maximals lower thier weapons to thier side awaiting Phobias next 
move.
> 
> "I'm coming out, please try to reserve judgement until later, I am 
> here to help.
> 
> The cargo plank lowers and a bright light is emmited from the 
inside 
> of the craft. (I think the light thing is an unwritten rule of sci-
fi-
> it seems every ship does it.) As the plank touches the ground a 
lone 
> figure steps into view, Predicon emblem shining almost tauntingly 
at 
> the center of his chest. "I am Phobia, and you are?"
> 
> -- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> > ::Kluster::
> > 
> > Kluster grins, looking down at Hysteria. "We? We're going to meet 
a 
> possible 
> > ally."
> > 
> > Phobia's ship was visible in front of them. Kluster quickens his 
> pace, 
> > activating his comm-link.
> > 
> > "We're aproaching your ship," he says into it, "Me and two bots. 
> Please do 
> > not be allarmed."
